meanings.definition: A specimen or population of organisms that is representative of a particular geographic location.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the topotype to learn more about the animals in that area.
meanings.sent2: The topotype of the bird species was found in the forest near the river.
meanings.sent3: The topotype decided to throw a party for all the other animals in the region.
meanings.sent4: The topotype stood out among the other specimens like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: The topotype was like a living map of the unique ecosystem.

meanings.definition: The specific location where a type specimen was originally collected.
meanings.sent1: We visited the topotype to see where the rare flower was first discovered.
meanings.sent2: The topotype of the mineral sample was deep within the cave.
meanings.sent3: The topotype seemed to be hiding secrets of its own underground.
meanings.sent4: The topotype held the key to unlocking the mystery of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent5: The topotype was like a time capsule preserving the history of its origin.
